Metadata.title: DOJ Epstein Files AI Search | Jeffrey Epstein Legal Documents Database
Metadata.description: Search and analyze 2,000+ DOJ Epstein case documents with AI-powered summaries. Explore Jeffrey Epstein legal records, court files, and official Department of Justice documents.
Metadata.ogTitle: DOJ Epstein Files AI Search Agent
Metadata.ogDescription: AI-powered search engine for Department of Justice Epstein documents. Get instant summaries and direct links to source PDFs.

HomePage.title: Search, analyze and contextualize DOJ Epstein documents
HomePage.subtitle: A conversation-driven search agent that directly queries DOJ data, with AI summaries and direct links to source files.
HomePage.exampleSearches: jeffrey, maxwell, island, victim, flight logs

ChatContainer.headerSubtitle: Search DOJ documents directly and get an AI summary.
ChatContainer.tip: Tip: click “Run deep analysis” to analyze a PDF on-demand.

MessageList.emptyDescription: Search the released documents from the Epstein case. Type a keyword such as a name, location, or event.

AboutCard.title: About this index
AboutCard.description: Search results are based on the DOJ multimedia-search index. PDF links open in a new tab on DOJ.gov.
AboutCard.feature1: Fast search mode uses indexed DOJ text.
AboutCard.feature2: Deep analysis fetches the PDF on-demand.

AboutPage.title: About | DOJ Epstein Files Search
AboutPage.metaDescription: Learn about the DOJ Epstein Files AI Search tool, our data sources, AI technology, and mission to make legal documents accessible.
AboutPage.heading: About DOJ Epstein Files Search
AboutPage.intro: This project provides free, AI-powered access to over 2,000 Department of Justice documents related to the Jeffrey Epstein case.
AboutPage.mission: Making legal documents accessible to journalists, researchers, and the public through advanced AI technology and conversational search.
AboutPage.dataSource: All documents are sourced directly from the official DOJ.gov multimedia search index. We do not host or modify any PDFs - all links point to original government sources.
AboutPage.technology: We use Groq's Llama 3.3 70B model for AI summaries, Playwright for document scraping, and Redis for caching. The search interface is built with Next.js and deployed on Vercel.
AboutPage.privacy: We don't track users, sell data, or require accounts. All searches are anonymous. Rate limiting prevents abuse while keeping the service free for everyone.

PrivacyPage.title: Privacy Policy | DOJ Epstein Files Search
PrivacyPage.metaDescription: Privacy policy for DOJ Epstein Files Search. Learn about data collection, cookies, third-party services, and GDPR compliance.
PrivacyPage.heading: Privacy Policy
PrivacyPage.intro: We are committed to protecting your privacy. This policy explains what data we collect and how we use it.
PrivacyPage.dataCollection: We collect minimal data: IP addresses for rate limiting (stored temporarily), search queries (not linked to users), and anonymized usage statistics. We do NOT collect personal information, emails, or create user profiles.
PrivacyPage.cookies: We use localStorage to save your chat history locally in your browser. If you opt in, advertising cookies are used for Google AdSense. You can change your choice at any time.
PrivacyPage.consent: When required by law (EEA/UK/CH), we request consent before loading advertising cookies. Your choice is stored with a timestamp, policy version, and locale for compliance auditing.
PrivacyPage.adsense: If you consent, Google AdSense may set cookies to deliver ads, measure performance, and prevent fraud. If you decline, ads may be less relevant.
PrivacyPage.withdraw: You can withdraw or change consent anytime using “Cookie preferences” in the header or by revisiting this page.
PrivacyPage.thirdParty: We use: Upstash (Redis caching), Groq (AI summaries), Vercel (hosting), and Google AdSense for advertising (only with consent). Each has their own privacy policy.
PrivacyPage.gdpr: EU users have the right to access, delete, or export their data. Since we don't store personal data, there's nothing to export. Clear your browser's localStorage to remove chat history.
PrivacyPage.contact: For privacy concerns, please open an issue on our GitHub repository.

FAQPage.title: FAQ | DOJ Epstein Files Search
FAQPage.metaDescription: Frequently asked questions about searching DOJ Epstein documents, AI summaries, data sources, and how to use the search tool effectively.
FAQPage.heading: Frequently Asked Questions
FAQPage.intro: Quick answers to the most common questions about the DOJ Epstein search, AI summaries, and source documents.
FAQPage.a1: You can search over 2,000 documents from the DOJ Epstein case, including court filings, victim statements, flight logs, and other legal records released by the Department of Justice.
FAQPage.q2: How does the AI search work?
FAQPage.a2: Fast mode searches the DOJ's indexed text and generates a summary. Deep mode downloads the full PDF and performs comprehensive analysis. Both use Groq's Llama 3.3 70B AI model.
FAQPage.a3: Yes. All PDF links point directly to DOJ.gov. We don't host, modify, or alter any documents. We only search and summarize them.
FAQPage.a4: Yes, completely free. We use rate limiting to prevent abuse. If you hit the limit, wait a few minutes and try again. Donations help cover hosting costs.
FAQPage.a5: Yes. Click any PDF link in the search results to open the original document on DOJ.gov. You can download from there.
FAQPage.q6: How accurate are the AI summaries?
FAQPage.a6: Summaries are generated by AI and may contain errors. Always verify important information by reading the source PDF. Summaries are meant to help you find relevant documents quickly.
FAQPage.a7: This is an independent open-source project built to make legal documents more accessible. We have no affiliation with the DOJ or any parties involved in the case.

ConsentBanner.title: Cookies for advertising
ConsentBanner.description: We use cookies to show ads via Google AdSense. You can accept or reject advertising cookies.
ConsentBanner.preferencesDescription: Allow advertising cookies to show personalized ads. You can change this anytime.
ConsentBanner.learnMore: Learn more in our privacy policy

Errors.rateLimitExceeded: Rate limit exceeded. Please try again in a few minutes.
Errors.invalidQuery: Invalid search query. Please try a different search term.

AgeVerification.title: Age Verification Required
AgeVerification.description: This website contains sensitive legal documents related to criminal cases. You must be 18 years or older to access this content.
AgeVerification.underageNotice: If you are under 18, please leave this website.

Footer.disclaimer: Not affiliated with the U.S. Department of Justice.
